001package gust.backend.model;
002
003import com.google.protobuf.ByteString;
004import com.google.protobuf.Descriptors;
005import com.google.protobuf.InvalidProtocolBufferException;
006import com.google.protobuf.Message;
007import com.google.protobuf.util.JsonFormat;
008
009import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
010import javax.annotation.Nullable;
011import javax.annotation.concurrent.Immutable;
012import javax.annotation.concurrent.ThreadSafe;
013import java.io.IOException;
014import java.io.ObjectInputStream;
015import java.io.ObjectOutputStream;
016import java.io.Serializable;
017import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
018import java.util.Arrays;
019import java.util.Objects;
020
021
022/**
023 * Container class for an encoded Protocol Buffer model. Holds raw encoded model data, in any of Protobuf's built-in
024 * well-defined serialization formats (for instance {@code BINARY} or {@code JSON}).
025 *
026 * <p>Raw model data is encoded before being held by this record. In addition to holding the raw data, it also keeps
027 * the fully-qualified path to the model that the data came from, and the serialization format the data lives in. After
028 * being wrapped in this class, a batch of model data is additionally compliant with {@link Serializable}.</p>
029 */
030@Immutable
031@ThreadSafe
032@SuppressWarnings({"unused", "WeakerAccess"})
033public final class EncodedModel implements Serializable, Cloneable {
034  private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
035
036  /** Raw bytes of the enclosed model. */
037  private @Nonnull byte[] rawBytes;
038
039  /** Type of model held by this entity. */
040  private @Nonnull String type;
041
042  /** Operating mode for the underlying data. Always {@code BINARY} unless manually constructed. */
043  private @Nonnull EncodingMode dataMode;
044
045  /**
046   * Initialize a new encoded model directly from a {@link Message}.
047   *
048   * @param rawBytes Raw bytes to hold.
049   * @param mode Operating data mode (usually {@code BINARY}).
050   * @param type Fully-qualified model type name.
051   */
052  private EncodedModel(@Nonnull byte[] rawBytes, @Nonnull EncodingMode mode, @Nonnull String type) {
053    this.type = type;
054    this.dataMode = mode;
055    this.rawBytes = rawBytes;
056  }
057
058  /**
059   * Write the attached encoded Protocol Buffer data to the specified object stream, such that this object is fully
060   * packed for Java serialization purposes.
061   *
062   * @param out Output stream to write this encoded model object to.
063   * @throws IOException If an IO error of some kind occurs.
064   */
065  private void writeObject(@Nonnull ObjectOutputStream out) throws IOException {
066    out.writeObject(type);
067    out.writeObject(dataMode);
068    out.write(rawBytes.length);
069    out.write(rawBytes);
070  }
071
072  /**
073   * Re-inflate an encoded model from a Java serialization context. Read the stream to install local properties, such
074   * that the object is re-constituted.
075   *
076   * @param in Input stream to read object data from.
077   * @throws IOException If an IO error of some kind occurs.
078   * @throws ClassNotFoundException If the specified Protobuf model cannot be found or resolved.
079   */
080  private void readObject(@Nonnull ObjectInputStream in) throws IOException,ClassNotFoundException {
081    this.type = Objects.requireNonNull((String)in.readObject(),
082      "Cannot deserialize EncodedModel with empty type.");
083    this.dataMode = Objects.requireNonNull((EncodingMode)in.readObject(),
084      "Cannot deserialize EncodedModel with empty data mode.");
085
086    // read length-prefixed raw bytes
087    int datasize = in.read();
088    byte[] data = new byte[datasize];
089    int read = in.read(data);
090    assert datasize == read;
091    this.rawBytes = data;
092  }
093
094  /**
095   * Return an encoded representation of the provided message. This method is rather heavy-weight: it fully encodes the
096   * provided Protobuf message into the Protocol Buffers binary format.
097   *
098   * <p>Note that this method must access the message's descriptor. If a descriptor is already on-hand, use the other
099   * variant of this method.</p>
100   *
101   * @see #from(Message, Descriptors.Descriptor) If a descriptor is already on-hand for the provided message.
102   * @param message Message to encode as binary.
103   * @return Java-serializable wrapper including the encoded Protobuf model.
104   */
105  public static EncodedModel from(@Nonnull Message message) {
106    return from(message, null);
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Return an encoded representation of the provided message. This method is rather heavy-weight: it fully encodes the
111   * provided Protobuf message into the Protocol Buffers binary format.
112   *
113   * <p>If a descriptor is <i>not</i> already on-hand, use the other variant of this method, which accesses the
114   * descriptor directly from the message.</p>
115   *
116   * @see #from(Message, Descriptors.Descriptor) If no descriptor is on-hand.
117   * @param message Message to encode as binary.
118   * @return Java-serializable wrapper including the encoded Protobuf model.
119   */
120  public static EncodedModel from(@Nonnull Message message, @Nullable Descriptors.Descriptor descriptor) {
121    return new EncodedModel(
122      message.toByteArray(),
123      EncodingMode.BINARY,
124      (descriptor != null ? descriptor : message.getDescriptorForType()).getFullName());
125  }
126
127  /**
128   * Wrap a blob of opaque data, asserting that it is actually an encoded model record. Using this factory method, any
129   * of the Protobuf serialization formats may be used safely with this class.
130   *
131   * <p>All details must be provided manually to this method variant. It is incumbent on the developer that they line
132   * up properly. For safer options, see the other factory methods on this class.</p>
133   *
134   * @see #from(Message) To encode a model instance.
135   * @see #from(Message, Descriptors.Descriptor) To encode a model instance with a descriptor already in-hand.
136   * @param type Fully-qualified type name, for the encoded instance we are storing.
137   * @param data Raw data for the encoded model to be wrapped.
138   * @return Encoded model instance.
139   */
140  public static EncodedModel wrap(@Nonnull String type, @Nonnull EncodingMode mode, @Nonnull byte[] data) {
141    return new EncodedModel(data, mode, type);
142  }
143
144  // -- Equals/Hash -- //
145
146  /** {@inheritDoc} */
147  @Override
148  public boolean equals(Object o) {
149    if (this == o) return true;
150    if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
151    EncodedModel that = (EncodedModel) o;
152    return com.google.common.base.Objects.equal(type, that.type) &&
153      dataMode == that.dataMode &&
154      com.google.common.base.Objects.equal(
155        Arrays.hashCode(rawBytes),
156        Arrays.hashCode(that.rawBytes));
157  }
158
159  /** {@inheritDoc} */
160  @Override
161  public int hashCode() {
162    return com.google.common.base.Objects
163      .hashCode(type, dataMode, Arrays.hashCode(rawBytes));
164  }
165
166  /** {@inheritDoc} */
167  @Override
168  public String toString() {
169    return "EncodedModel{" +
170      "dataMode='" + dataMode + '\'' +
171      ", type=" + type +
172      '}';
173  }
174
175  // -- Getters -- //
176
177  /** @return Raw bytes held by this encoded model. */
178  public @Nonnull ByteString getRawBytes() {
179    return ByteString.copyFrom(this.rawBytes);
180  }
181
182  /** @return Fully-qualified path to the type of model backing this encoded instance. */
183  public @Nonnull String getType() {
184    return type;
185  }
186
187  /** @return Operating mode for the underlying model instance data. */
188  public @Nonnull EncodingMode getDataMode() {
189    return dataMode;
190  }
191
192  // -- Inflate -- //
193
194  /**
195   * Re-inflate the encoded model data held by this object, into an instance of {@code Model}, via the provided
196   * {@code builder}.
197   *
198   * <p><b>Note:</b> before the model is returned from this method, it will be casted to match the generic type the user
199   * is looking for. It is incumbent on the invoking developer to make sure the generic access that occurs won't produce
200   * a {@link ClassCastException}. {@link #getType()} can be interrogated to resolve types before inflation.</p>
201   *
202   * @param model Empty model instance from which to resolve a parser.
203   * @param <Model> Generic model type inflated and returned by this method.
204   * @return Instance of the model, inflated from the encoded data.
205   * @throws InvalidProtocolBufferException If the held data is incorrectly formatted.
206   */
207  public @Nonnull <Model extends Message> Model inflate(@Nonnull Message model) throws InvalidProtocolBufferException {
208    if (dataMode == EncodingMode.JSON) {
209      Message.Builder builder = model.newBuilderForType();
210      JsonFormat.parser().merge(
211        new String(this.rawBytes, StandardCharsets.UTF_8),
212        builder);
213
214      //noinspection unchecked
215      return (Model)builder.build();
216    } else {
217      //noinspection unchecked
218      return (Model)model.getParserForType().parseFrom(this.rawBytes);
219    }
220  }
221}
